reason: RELATIONSHIP TO STANDARD POSITIVITY UNCLEAR: By definition of M (node 1.2), M contains all elements of the form a^* a. A standard positive functional satisfies phi(a^* a) >= 0 for ALL a. Since M contains all such elements, does 'positivity on M' actually imply STANDARD positivity? If YES, then why not just define M-positive states as standard positive states + normalization? If NO, then M-positivity is strictly weaker than standard positivity, and we need to understand what M captures that standard positivity doesn't.
